title: Real-Time Policy Calculus (RTPC) Configuration
description: Defines the structured parameters for the autonomous Risk/Trust Policy Calculus engine (P-01/GRCM). All derived scores are normalized [0.0, 1.0].

policyVersion.description: Semantic versioning identifier for the configuration.

trustDecayFactor.description: The rate at which accrued trust decays (must be between 0.5 and 1.0). High values mean slower decay.

riskMetrics.description: Weights and configuration for integrating external risk assessments and services.

riskMitigationWeight.description: Normalization weight applied to aggregate risk mitigation scores.

serviceWeights.description: List of contributory services and their relative influence weights. Total weights should sum near 1.0 for true normalization.

serviceId.description: Unique system ID of the contributing service (e.g., 'NETWORK_HEALTH').

trustThresholds.description: Normalized boundary values [0.0, 1.0] defining mandatory operational states (Critical < Alert < Operational).

criticalScore.description: Trust score below which execution must terminate or quarantine immediately (0.0 - 0.2).

alertScore.description: Trust score triggering high-priority review and limited operations (0.1 - 0.5).

operationalMinimum.description: Minimum score required for standard, unconstrained execution (0.6 - 1.0).
